nodes.text: it is difficult to understand Reid Birley's claims that allegations against her are without substance.

It is also a matter of record that two very senior managers recruited from an historically disadvantaged university and who can scarcely be said to be anti-transformation reactionaries have distanced themselves from Reid Birley.

Multiple Wits sources of varied ideological and other hues say that signs emerged very early in Reid Birley's tenure that she was extraordinarily difficult to work with and that the unanimous initial goodwill towards her steadily dissipated among those who had to interact with her daily.

We report this week that senior Wits academics whom we name with their permission and whose own transformation and gender credentials are impeccable despairingly recount that Reid Birley repeatedly rejected long-term attempts at constructive intervention.
Reid Birley behaved in an asocial and bad manner therefore allegations are supported by evidence
If allegations are supported they are not without substance
Reid Birley was a problem for people that were working with her
A bad asocial  behaviour causes socialization problems
Reid Birley rejected long-termattempts at constructive intervention
Refusal of attempts at contructive intervention is a bad behaviour
If a person is not sociable at all even the most open-minded people distance themselves from him or her
